repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rural Poverty Alleviation and
            Natural Resources Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for Brazil - Rural Poverty
            Alleviation and Natural Resources Management Project were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and the borrower performance was satisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: Project experience showed that a
            skillful and dedicated Project Management Unit, with
            appropriate political support and capable of establishing
            and maintaining a dialogue with the various executing
            agencies, is essential to successful implementation. The use
            of micro-catchments as planning units was a key to success.
            A high quality comprehensive project manual is essential in
            order to guide and coordinate activities. It was very
            important for poor beneficiaries to buy-in to the
            implementation of subprojects through family labor or other
            contributions as it serves to create a sense of ownership.
            On-time provision of counterpart funds with strict
            compliance with the amounts included in annual budgets has
            proved to be vital for effective implementation of this type
            of project. When a project is faced with frequent changes in
            administration, it is important for the Bank to conduct an
            intense schedule of supervision missions. Natural resources
            management, rural poverty alleviation and income generation
            in very poor communities should always include an effective
            process of participatory and decentralized planning. A
            highly decentralized structure, including regional
            commissions working closely with municipal councils, acting
            like their advisors and articulating activities with project
            management units are very important to create an efficient
            flow of subprojects. The availability of sound project
            management tools like SAFF and highly skilled professional
            services backing this information system has been very
            important in terms of the performance of the Project
            Implementation Unit.

5082864.trustfund: TF033904-BRAZIL - AGRICULTURE,TF033279-BRAZIL - PARANA RURAL POVERTY PROJECT
5082864.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Social dev/gender/inclusion

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Parana Rural Poverty Alleviation
            and Natural Resources Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Parana Rural
            Poverty Alleviation and Natural Resources Management Project
            are to increase the incomes and improve the living
            conditions of approximately 255,000 rural poor and small
            farmer households by supporting the implementation of
            community-demanded investment subprojects. The project also
            aims to protect the state's natural resources by
            promoting sustainable practices for improved land management
            and soil and water quality conservation. The project will
            comprise two main components: 1) poverty alleviation
            investment component, which will finance social and
            income-generating investment; and 2) natural resource
            management and agricultural modernization investments; and
            2) technical support services component involving
            institutional strengthening, technical assistance, training,
            adaptive research and studies.
